__katie_may_1: Dreadlocks symbolise the Rastafarian movement and the Lion of Judah, with the dreadlocks being inspired by the Nazirite’s in the bible who were not allowed to cut their hair as apart of their religious vows. The Nazirites were Hebrew and ethnically Jewish, stories within the Hebrew Bible refer to figures such as Samson as wearing dreadlocks. Rastafarian’s partake in the Nazirite vow which were adopted laws derived from Leviticus, which accounts for some similarity to the Jewish dietary law of Kashrut. Ethnic Jews have a variety of skin tones ranging in dark and light. Dreadlocks do not belong to one skin tone or hair type.

blackgreywhite639: I find this hilarious as a white (i am puerto rican but look and raised in a white household) female with dreadlocks.. And i completely agree with you upon the format from which you speak. I started following this page because i want to get over anything that may make me feel uncomfortable as a white person, which it does not. I applaud and agree with what you have to say. So i thought about maybe i should reconsider my dreads. But i cannot, because i would be playing into a system that is playing all of us and turning us against each other. I refuse to be of this world. I also refuse to blend in with typical white culture. I am nature love and spirit, not my skin. I choose to celebrate those cultures that have saved me and brought me to a place of peace and understanding with all of the beings around me and all of the darkness that tried to rob me of such love and understanding. Plus.. My hair locked all its own haha. No chemicals no palm rolling, nothing tied around them to shape them, just time and tearing. I get you i support what you say and if it was said to my face i would agree because in the world you live, it is wrong. But i am not in that world. The best way to tear down the system is to defy it, not play into it and stand next to those it is hurting with full love understanding and support. I promise many posts like this have changed my view on a lot of things, humbled me and forced me to admit i am wrong. Which at this point i love doing, i have an immense love for failing and learning now. i have allowed this post to take time in my heart and mind and weigh and on my personal choices, and it probably still will after i post this just to make sure i really feel what i feel and not just a white defense post. I am against trends and would never put something in or on my body for fashion or vanity. My spirit means a lot to me and i take care of it so i can take better care of the world around me. Love. Sincerely. I dont hope to change minds because your thoughts are valid and important and will bring others to the right place. I just want you to know that some white person with dreads feels you hears you gets it.
